meanings.definition: A person of equal rank, status, or ability
meanings.sent1: In the competition, my compeers showed great skill and determination.
meanings.sent2: She considered her compeers in the industry as valuable allies.
meanings.sent3: At the talent show, my compeers and I had a friendly rivalry.
meanings.sent4: Among the group of friends, he stood out as the compeer with the most experience.
meanings.sent5: The compeers in the team worked together seamlessly to achieve success.

meanings.definition: To be on an equal footing with someone
meanings.sent1: I strive to compeer with my colleagues in terms of productivity.
meanings.sent2: He compeers with his classmates in academic performance.
meanings.sent3: The two teams compeered in a fair and friendly match.
meanings.sent4: She compeers with her siblings in athletic abilities.
meanings.sent5: The young artist compeers with established painters in skill and technique.
